definition: (fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: The talent show in the evening drew the curtain with guitar playing.
sentences.chinese: 晚間的才藝表演在吉它的彈唱中拉開序幕。

sentences.english: The concert in the solemn GuoGeSheng in between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 音樂會在莊嚴的中俄兩國國歌聲中拉開序幕。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會在一片歡快的鑼鼓聲中拉開序幕。

sentences.english: The good news for foreign companies is that the game is still early.
sentences.chinese: 對外國公司來說，好消息是這齣戲纔剛剛拉開序幕。

sentences.english: The all-Russia annual carving contest takes place in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的俄羅斯雕刻大賽在莫斯科拉開序幕。
